file_content.text: Huh. You fight good--Cipher.
I don't expect mercy. The Shadow Arsenal was my chance to stop the war... and I failed.
Give yourself up. It's the only way to survive.
Surrender or die.
If the Republic doesn't win this... be gracious, and be kind.
Turn away, Ardun. I'm not going to kill you.
Leave here and you'll survive.
No. You're not. But why, after all we've been through...?
I'm sparing you; leave it at that.
Just get out of here.
We've all committed terrible acts. That doesn't mean we should die for them.
You deserve better.
For what it's worth--I hope we don't have to meet again.
May the Force be with you, my friend.
You're a lot more forgiving than I am. Guess we're done here, though.
That was kind. Whether it was wise...at least things seem to be resolved.
I don't think I understood any of that, sir, but I'll trust your judgment.
Ardun Kothe of the SIS. How interesting. Well--anything else on the agenda?
Our enemies may be gone, but we can't leave the Shadow Arsenal in place.
There's still the missiles.
So far as Keeper is concerned, Ardun Kothe escaped.
Let's not report this.
Hey, I'm always up for lying to your bosses.
Of course. We haven't been in this business long, but we're catching on.
Yes, sir.
The last thing I want is to see your career suffer.
Forget it. I don't like answering questions.
Never mind. [Kill him]
You're going to die knowing the Republic will fall.
You failed utterly. [Kill him]
There is no death. There is the Force.
So much for the great hope of the SIS. Guess that does it for the mission, too.
Then it's over. We stopped him and his plan... that was the mission.
He's not getting back up. I think we just saved the Empire.
Ardun Kothe, gone forever. How will the Watchers stay awake at night without him plotting away?
It's been a long assignment. Now it's finally over.
Time to go home.
Don't tell me you're getting tired? We can always go freelance....
Some rest would do us good. We know a planet in the Outer Rim, air the color of ocean....
Yes, sir. Congratulations.
Tell me, Cipher--what exactly was your assignment here?
Ardun Kothe may be dead, but we can't leave the Shadow Arsenal in place.
There's still the missiles....
Give me ten minutes, I'll find a buyer. We can be rich.
We see your point. Maybe we should call the nest--a line of two hundred Killiks, each with a missile on its back....
I can see if I can contact Quesh Command, if you like....
Agreed. I'm sure the Minister of War and the Science Bureau will fight for possession....
Self-righteous prig. Even this was too good for him.
I'll spit on his grave.
Yeah, well, get over it. We've got to figure what to do next.
Spiting him won't get you anywhere. Come away from the body.
What did he do to you, sir?
And you always struck me as a forgiving person.
Cipher! Imperial again, huh? And no more programming--that is a surprise.
I was finished with Ardun, but I had plans for you. We could've wandered the galaxy together--me as the captain, you as my servant.
Ardun Kothe was your commanding officer. What do you mean "finished with him"?
What are you saying?
Give it up. The Shadow Arsenal is out of your hands.
You and the SIS have lost.
And that is too bad, but no one else is getting it, either.
The thought of traveling with you makes my skin crawl.
Sick freak.
No time for flirting now.
You wound me.
Big changes are coming. Imperial Intelligence and the SIS... history will forget them. And it'll forget you.
I just tipped off a squadron of Imperial bombers. That facility is about to be wiped out.
What's this about? Whose side are you on?
Who are you working for?
I'm on the winning side.
Neither of us is who we appear to be. Maybe we can talk this through.
Let's discuss this.
Interesting thought, but I'm going to say "no."
Goodbye, Cipher. When the bombs rain down, the Shadow Arsenal will make a spectacular crater.
I'll claw my way out of the rubble to hunt you down. Do you hear me?
You're a dead man.
Loud and clear. I'm sure you'll be a nasty pile of dust.
Blasted machine.
Locking mechanisms disengaged.
Legate. That must mean Saber and Wheel are dead.
They didn't deserve that. I take it you're free?
Legate. I thought I felt you. You're supposed to be back at the shields--
I see. You're free, aren't you?
Your keyword won't work anymore.
Yes, I'm free.
You used Imperial programming inside my mind. Where did you learn about it?
How did you brainwash me?
That hardly matters now.
What I did to you was unforgivable. But I did it anyway.
An Imperial Intelligence defector... just when I needed one! I couldn't risk it being a lie.
Tell me where you got the keyword. Tell me how you did it!
I asked about brainwashing!
Just a source. Ain't that the way?
Your mission has failed. You're not getting the Shadow Arsenal.
This ends now.
We could've worked together. You never even gave me a chance.
You should've trusted me.
Wouldn't then. Can't now.
I played you from the start. Your mission was always doomed.
I fooled you this whole time.
No. I don't believe that.
Do you know what happens when you cage an animal? He gets vicious.
I can finally hurt you.
Do you know what happens when you cage an animal? She gets vicious.
I can finally hurt you.
Is that how you think?
You've shown me your true face. Let me show you mine.
Before Ardun Kothe the SIS chief, there was a better man. A Jedi Knight who couldn't live up to the code.
That Jedi can't live in a world of shadows... but maybe he can still save the galaxy.
I've been thinking about this fight a long time, Ardun.
We'll see about that.
I'm ashamed to say it--but so have I.
I thought I saw it in you. You never did much to hide it.
You finally tell the truth.
No. Call it my secret pride.
You failed at being a Jedi. Now you fail at being a spy. Time to die.
Pathetic old man.
No choice. Deactivate it.
This is Legate. Shields are down. The shuttle is clear to land.
And Saber did her part. We'll have the Shadow Arsenal on board and headed for Republic space within the hour.
You're going to hold position here--protect the controls until we're gone.
I'm your best operative. I should be acquiring the missiles, not standing guard.
That's absurd.
You're very good. Doesn't change my decision.
Do you have a rendezvous in mind?
What about afterward?
You don't want me near the missiles.
You're getting rid of me.
You've done your part. There's no reason to make you face this.
Legate... this is goodbye for now. Go back to Imperial Intelligence, shore up your contacts. We'll be in touch in a few months.
They don't need you anymore.
Hold position. Keyword: onomatophobia. And thank you.
They're going to win. Now we're out of time.
If they get the Shadow Arsenal off Quesh, this war becomes a lot bloodier.
We need to stop the SIS.
The serum was supposed to break my programming.
I thought I'd be free by now.
I don't need your assessment. I need a way out.
Never helpful, are you?
The IX serum has been eating at you since you injected it. Carving neural pathways. Bleaching your brain.
It isn't finished, but it'll have to suffice.
We're going to rewrite your programming. New commands, new keyword, no outside control. Are you ready?
Let's do it.
I'm ready.
You said the serum isn't finished. What am I risking?
What if this goes wrong?
Permanent vegetative state. But it's not like we have a choice.
How do I know you're not planning to control me yourself?
I still don't trust you.
Whether I'm a chip in your spine or your mind crying for help, I'm part of you.
Thesh protocol, phase one. New keyword: iconoclasm.
Keyword accepted. Thesh protocol engaged.
Now you have access. You can force your mind and body to obey a new program.
Tell me what you want.
No more programming. No more outside control.
I want to be free forever.
Reject command interface. Accept no further orders.
Command interface closed.
I want to go beyond what this body is capable of. No more pain or exhaustion.
Push me past my limits.
Dangerous. Interesting.
Embed limit break commands. Keyword activate from user only. Accept no outside orders.
Limit break commands embedded. Accepting no further orders.
Nothing is going to stop me from getting revenge. Not anymore.
All I want is payback.
Embed assassination commands. Keyword activate from user only. Accept no outside orders.
Assassination commands embedded. Accepting no further orders.
Revert to phase zero.
You're free now. Time for me to go.
But stop the SIS. Find out how they obtained Imperial brainwashing codes. There are truths you need to know.
Hey! You zoned out. What's going on?
Agent--are you alright? You disappeared on us.
Change of plans. We're not undercover anymore--we're going to stop Ardun Kothe.
We have a mission to finish.
It's about time. I was starting to think you'd gone soft.
Understood. We knew this was coming.
Sir? What's going on? Can you hear me?
Focus, Cipher. Your pupils are dilated, but your heart rate is steady--I know you're not dying.
Those holocalls I've been getting? The people making them are our new targets. Let's go.
We have a mission to finish.
Yes, sir. I just hope you're going to explain this later....
The usual change of plans, then. Whenever you're ready.
I'm better than I've been in a long time. Just follow my lead.
Don't worry about me.
You know you sound crazy? I like that.
Your aura is different. Brighter... we're glad to see you back.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you looked different. Let's go.
And here you had me worried. I'm ready when you are.
I'll explain later. Just follow my lead.
It's a long story...
You know I'm up for anything, but I do like to know why.
Of course. We always have so far.
You know I will. Let's go.
Who else would I follow?
This is code name Legate. I'm in position; awaiting orders.
Legate. Nice to see you outside Hoth. Little color in the air brings out your eyes.
I look forward to the day I don't have to tolerate your leering.
You're an idiot.
You make it sound like it bothers you.
Legate. How's Quesh compare to Hoth? Find any pretty ensigns?
Nar Shaddaa, Hoth, Quesh... we can't get away from each other, can we?
You certainly get around.
What can I say? We're on the same team now.
Where's base command?
I was expecting Ardun Kothe.
Not far.
How you survive in this business I'll never know.
You're an idiot.
We all have our secrets.
Hunter to deck. Report in.
Code name Saber in position. Good to see you, Legate.
Code name Wheel ready for operations.
And I'll be in position shortly. It's good to see you together as a team. Too many solo jobs, nowadays.
But now we're together for the most important job we've ever done. We're here for a weapon--one that can stop this war.
What sort of weapon, sir?
A weapon?
Does he start every team mission like this?
We have to hear a speech?
He can't help it. Brought up in a temple.
[Remain silent]
Over a decade ago, Colonel Omas of Republic Special Forces assembled a team of the galaxy's greatest scientists.
The scientists, led by Nasan Godera, were instructed to design a weapon capable of turning back the Imperial threat:
A "Shadow Arsenal" of missiles--cloaked from detection and more powerful than any made before.
Colonel Omas died at the Battle of Hoth. Nasan Godera moved on to other things. Everyone assumed the Shadow Arsenal was never completed.
But it was. Nasan Godera built the Shadow Arsenal on Quesh--then concealed it in a fit of conscience.
These missiles--that's what we've been working toward.
You needed us to find it.
A man doesn't build an arsenal without knowing what it'll be used for.
Why hide the weapon he made?
Godera couldn't have found a nice tropical world?
Ugly choice of location.
Poison gas atmosphere deters most guests.
Without the colonel to lead them, the scientists decided the weapon was too destructive. Godera called it "catastrophic." He wiped all records.
That's why you all've been running around the galaxy.
The Ultrawave Transmitter had Nasan Godera's weapon activation codes. Colonel Omas's shuttle, the Starbreeze, led us to this star system.
And the assault on Mon Gazza? Wheel and I...
Gave us one more key.
Nasan Godera wiped all records of the weapon. Called it "catastrophic," didn't want it used.
There are two hundred missiles in the Shadow Arsenal; only takes one to destroy Kaas City. Threat alone should make the Sith surrender.
Your plan won't work. Destroy Kaas City, destroy the Korriban Academy... they'll only want revenge.
The Empire won't surrender.
Then we'll have to fight.
How can a missile be so powerful?
Tell me more about the weapon.
Each one has a cloaking device, a short-range hyperdrive and a warhead with a kick. The ultimate first strike weapon.
If we're going after this arsenal, let's do it.
Get on with it.
The missiles are still inside the old manufacturing complex--two square kilometers of factories and tunnels.
Sealed up but still intact. The scientists couldn't bear to destroy their work, so they built defenses fifty years ahead of Republic standard.
We're going to secure the facility; I'll bring in the shuttle and locate the Shadow Arsenal.
Saber, take out the main batteries. Wheel, see what you can do with the main computer.
Affirmative.
Legate, you'll penetrate the structure at these coordinates. Bypass the droids and lower the facility shields so our shuttle can land.
Just stay in contact. You'll know when it's done.
I'll handle it.
The best defenses Republic minds have to offer. I could use a little exercise.
This should be interesting.
May the Force be with us, my friends. Ending linkup.
And Legate? In case you had any doubts--keyword: onomatophobia. You will lower the shields. And the Shadow Arsenal will be ours.
This plan is insane. I can't go along with it.
I won't do this.
Keyword: onomatophobia. You will lower the shields and complete this mission.
Stop it. Legate... we'll talk about your reservations after. I promise.
May the Force be with us all.
This is Legate to base command. Mission complete.
Base command here. Hunter gave me his report.
He spoke highly of you. Not a lot of people earn his praise.
The man was nothing but a very snide obstacle.
He's insufferable.
He's testing you. He's good at that.
How did he come to join the SIS?
Tell me about him.
Used to do corporate security, if you can believe it. Recruited him a few years back.
It was my pleasure to work with him. He was nothing if not professional.
We made a good team.
I'm glad you think so. You may have to work with him again.
I'm grateful the Starbreeze is in one piece. She'll help us win this war.
Now... Hoth and Taris makes two. Ready for the final stage?
I serve at your command.
I'm ready, sir.
You still haven't told me what this is about. You send me after a Republic shuttle and a science project...
Final stage of what?
All for good reason. I promise.
Running out of charming spots to send me to?
It's about time.
Heh. You didn't like those, you're really not going to like this world.
Maybe you've heard of it: a death trap of a planet called Quesh. Our primary objective's there; I want you en route.
On my way, sir.
Understood.
Can you be more specific than "death trap"?
What should I expect?
It's a mining world... our forces are fighting the Empire for chemical deposits. But you're after something else entirely.
Chemical mining world. We're at war over it.
I've been there before.
That's the one. But we're after something from before all that.
Get to these coordinates when you arrive, and we'll be in touch. Base command out.
Speak to Ardun Kothe now, and you'll never get away. You need to escape.
It's in your head. You can't keep it there.
This is Legate to base command. I have retrieved the Ultrawave Transmitter.
Base command here. Connect the Godera device to your linkup. I'll download what I need.
I got word from the sector station chief. Said he got a call from Ki Sazen. She wants to join us.
Ki Sazen is a broken young woman. She needs help to get better.
She wants redemption.
I thought you'd like this outcome.
You don't sound thrilled.
The Force guides us to strange places.
The best thing you can do is put her in a cell. Or a tomb.
The Jedi's a lunatic.
No. Not if she's come to us.
I'm the last person who should mentor Ki Sazen, but I'll talk to Master Satele on the Jedi Council--see if I can figure something.
I got word Ki Sazen escaped Taris. Took a shuttle headed for Imperial space.
She had too many guards. By the time I got through them, it was either her or the transmitter.
I couldn't stop her.
I gave her safe passage into the Empire in exchange for the transmitter. That was your priority.
We made a bargain.
Yes, it was.
Find that shuttle. She's a lunatic; she can't reach safe haven.
You need to destroy her!
I'm doing what I can, but not a lot of extra fighters in this sector. I hate when Jedi go bad.
A Special Forces team found Ki Sazen dead with her guards. I'll have to inform the Jedi Council.
I know you wanted proof of her corruption, but she forced my hand.
I'm sorry this happened.
How are you going to explain it?
What will you say?
I'll give them as much of the truth as I can; maybe they'll learn from their mistakes.
Ki Sazen was insane. Death was a mercy.
She was irredeemable.
Damnation. Not everyone's fit to be a Jedi; the order's practically asking them to fall. And then...
Download's complete. Let's hope the genius in that thing helps us win this war.
It's breaking your skull. Can you hear it crack?
You don't look so good, Legate. Take a few days, check in with your bosses; we'll have another job soon.
Can you see?
Cipher Nine. Legate. Hand of Jadus. It's been a while since Shadow Town.
Cipher Nine. Legate. Disposable operative. It's been a while since Shadow Town.
Watcher X. The Nar Shaddaa mission. Intelligence had you imprisoned there.
I remember you.
Yes. Formerly Watcher Five. Formerly Minder Eight. I helped you with your terrorist problem.
I can't move. I can barely think. What's going on?
What's happening to me?
Whatever you're doing to me... I'll survive. And you'll regret this.
You've made a big mistake.
I never regret anything. But I'm not your enemy.
When you met me on Nar Shaddaa, I was designated Watcher X. Formerly Watcher Five. Formerly Minder Eight.
I performed surgery on you--before you murdered me. A chip in your spine, to disguise your life readings.
I performed surgery on you. Do you remember? A chip in your spine, to disguise your life readings.
Maybe that chip is how we're talking now. Or maybe it's the stress--double agent, triple agent... the brainwashing damages your mind.
Only the SIS knows about the programming. I can't even talk about it.
You know I'm brainwashed...
If you're not a hallucination, this must be a backup system in the chip....
Are you real?
A limited intelligence program wired into the brain and triggered by neuroendocrine reactions. I suppose it's possible.
Sorry, but I meet a lot of Watchers. I don't recall your face.
Are you sure we've met?
Inattention to detail would explain your predicament.
They put you away because you went insane. You're not one to talk about brain damage.
I'm not the crazy one here.
On the contrary. There's no one more perfect--situationally and genetically.
You weren't hard to kill before. This time, I'll make sure it's permanent.
Maybe I'll murder you again.
Right now, you can't even hold a blaster.
I was in your position, once. Trapped by my conditioning, forced to subvert it. I warned you they'd do the same to you.
The SIS isn't to blame. We both know you were programmed before you met them.
If the SIS didn't brainwash me, who did?
What are you saying?
The Republic doesn't have the technology. Brainwashing is an Imperial science.
The Empire did this.
Yes. Slave serums, genetic engineering, Killik pheromones. But this, I don't recognize.
I never heard the keyword before I met the SIS chief.
Ardun Kothe is responsible.
Of course you did. You just don't remember.
You've seen brainwashing technology before: slave-control serums on Dromund Kaas; loyalty instincts bred into Watchers; an Imperial diplomat infused with Killik pheromones.
The Republic is only using what the Empire put in your mind.
Suppose you're right. What did they do to me, and how did the Republic gain access?
How could this happen?
I don't know. Being dead limits my resources.
I don't know, and I don't know. I have my limits.
Imperial Intelligence has never betrayed me.
I don't believe it.
Still trusting. Still devoted to Watcher Two? Or Keeper now, I understand.
Only because the necessity hasn't arisen.
If you know so much about brainwashing... how do I escape?
Tell me how to break free.
If you want freedom--if you want revenge--we need more information. Imperial Intelligence will have records on Dromund Kaas.
Take your personnel files from the Citadel archives. Ensure no one sees you. You have no allies now.
Readings are stable... ah! Our patient is awake.
We found you in the plague-sleep. We watched but could not mend you.
I appreciate the thought, but I'll be alright. Just exhausted.
Thanks for the concern.
Found you kissing floor. You look like hell.
Prep the ship for flight. I need to pay a visit to the Citadel.
We're going to Dromund Kaas.
Of course. We'll be ready presently.
Yeah, sure. We can all spend time with Keeper.
Kaliyo. You always know how to make me feel better.
That's sweet of you.
Guy called Jono used to tell me the same thing. Great body. Don't mess with me like he did.
I'm fine. Thank you.
Someone's changed my brain....
No. You're not. But this isn't the hive, and we can't hear your thoughts. We respect your privacy.
Yeah, sure. Look, I don't want to hear you whine, but... if there's something I should know? Make sure you tell me.
It's been a while since I played ship's doctor... but there is something odd here, Cipher.
You don't have any business here.
Reading an ion buildup; I need to bring the shuttle down now. Legate, Saber, it's all up to you.
I sense something dangerous. Be careful, all of you.
Saber, some kind of aerial drone headed your way.
Ah! I'm alright. I'll get those batteries offline.
Interface terminal located. Deactivating blast door seals. You should have a clear path, Legate.
Saber to deck. These droids are nasty... can we take some of them home, along with the missiles?
Mistress Saber--you're going to make me feel unwanted.
Watch the banter. But it's not a bad idea.
